wikipedia_page.main: James Kendrick Pyne (5 February 1852 – 3 September 1938) was an English organist and composer.

response: Born into a theatrical family as Louisa Fanny Pyne, she was the youngest daughter of the alto George Griggs Pyne (1790–1877)."Marriages", The Times, 20 October 1868, pg. 1 Her elder sister Susanna Pyne (1821–86) was also an accomplished singer and her uncle James Kendrick Pyne (1785–1857) was a tenorCharles Edward Horn's Memoirs of His Father and Himself, Charles Edward Horn (Author), Michael Kassler (Editor), 2003 whose son and grandson, both named James Kendrick Pyne, were distinguished organists."Obituaries, Dr. J. K. Pyne Distinguished Organist", The Times, 5 September 1938, pg. 14Louisa Pyne, short biography by Dr Michael Burden, New College, Oxford Her niece, Blanche Whiffen, had a long career in America on stage and later in cinema.Mrs. Thomas Whiffen, Noted Actress, Dead-Chicago Daily Tribune; 27 November 1936; pg. 14
Hallam was born on 4 September 1887 in Nottingham. He studied the organ with James Kendrick Pyne at Manchester Cathedral.
He studied organ under James Kendrick Pyne at Manchester Cathedral.

In his youth he was a pupil of the organist James Kendrick PyneFrank Baker, I Follow But Myself (1968), p. 152. (who had been a pupil of Samuel Sebastian Wesley). He retained his skill at organ-playing and his interest in music throughout his life, and even wrote a few compositions.
